1.content:
"Well, ain't this a fine day" muttered Chris Skyler, as he walked home from school.

Chris' life was fairly ordinary. He had good friends, wasn't too popular, and got good grades. Not a bad life at all. Unfortunately, it was boring at times. Like today for example. Just another day of sophmore life for Chris.

"Maybe some games will help cheer me up" muttered Chris, smiling a bit. He loved video games of course, as he played them all the time when he could. His favorite series was the Fire Emblem series, a game series had he didn't have much interest in at first, but he was immediately hooked on to it when he played one of it's games.

As Chris walked along the trail leading back to his house, the sun happened to glimmer off something shiny. Chris brought his hands up to his eyes to shield them from the light. Once he got a good look at it, he saw that it was some small bronze medallion of some sorts.

"Hmm, what's this?" he asked himself as he picked it up. The medallion didn't look like anything special to Chris. He figured that it must just be some kind of junk that someone left behind.

"Well, might as well take it home" he said to himself, shrugging his shoulders. He pocketed the medallion and continued on his merry way. Right now, it was about 3:30, which was when his school got out. His younger siblings, who were in elementary school right now, wouldn't be home until 4:00. His parents were probably out with work at the moment.

With that in mind, Chris approached his house and walked in after unlocking the door. He, of course, had no idea of just what kind of power he was bringing into his house.

So, it's now time to decide. Soon enough, someone will change. Who it is? That is to be determined. However, for now, let's figure out what the first transformation shall be.

First, which game will it be from?
1.title: The Medallion

121.content:
Chris entered his room, throwing his backpack onto the ground and letting out a final sigh of relief; he was home. He decided to immediately take up his own offer to play some video games in peace before his little siblings came home. He looked along his shelf at all the games for various systems he had stocked up. He was in a Fire Emblem mood for some reason. He didn't want to take the five minutes out of his game time to set up his TV with a game console, so he decided on a handheld game. He'd played Sacred Stones, Blazing Sword, Shadow Dragon, and Awakening a little too much lately and so he reached for one of his most prized possessions, an original GameBoy Advance cartridge for Fire Emblem: The Sword of Seals, which he got on eBay a few weeks ago. It was in Japanese, of course, but Chris had played the English hack on his computer enough to be able to play blindfolded and still get the basic story.

He reached up for the cartridge and held it in his hand... and then he felt funny. At first it felt like he was sick to his stomach with butterflies but then the sensation spread out his extremities to his entire body. He felt himself fall and he blacked out...

He came to, still feeling a little dizzy. He noticed according to his clock that he'd only been out for a minute or two at best, which was weird. He still felt dizzy as he stood up. He shook his head a couple of times to clear it, which somewhat did the trick. He noticed almost immediately then that his clothes were different. They tinkled a little when he walked, he was wearing some armor pieces, blue plated with gleaming golden trim. It felt weird wearing a chest plate and shoulder pads made of steel, but apparently Chris didn't mind the weight, as if he were used to it. He had heavy boots on, mostly leather but with iron fittings surrounding his ankle, again mostly blue with gold trim. He had white trousers made of a sort of heavy cloth, almost like canvas in terms of toughness but slightly more soft. Under his armor was a sleeveless tunic of blue cloth again with golden trim, this time as smooth as satin, and a belt of simple leather held the tunic together at the waist. Under that was a black short sleeved shirt, thick and with a turtle neck of sorts. He felt around his head at this point a cloth headband, probably blue and gold. The most impressive article of clothing on his person, however, was his cape. Blue on the outside, red on the inside, it made this strange outfit 4 times as heroic. Last, he noticed had blue fingerless gloves and iron gauntlets on his arms.

And then the freakiness of the situation kicked into overdrive. Chris looked at his arms. He definitely remembered not being quite that pale before... or that ripped. He looked at his arms and he looked like he'd been working out for some time. His biceps when he flexed them bulged quite a bit. Naturally, he wasn't grotesquely muscled like one of the body builders on TV, instead it looked like each and every muscle in his arm had been trained to that size with discipline and necessity.

Chris shook his head, "Just what has happened to m-!!" he gasped at his own voice, "My voice! Holy crap! Is that my voice?" The voice was that of an adolescent young man, any guy from Chris's High School could've owned that voice. But it was definitely not Chris's. It was a little higher pitched and had a tinge of a sort of English-ish accent to it. He immediately ran for his closet, his armor pieces clinking a bit with him. He grabbed the full body mirror he kept in his closet and put it down against the wall.

"Oh. My. GOD!!" he cried to himself as he gazed upon the utterly amazing sight in the mirror. He gaped, his eyes wide. There, in the mirror, stood a guy looking about 15 years old. He had a shock of ultra red hair, longish and unkempt, kept out of his face by a blue and gold cloth headband. He had the most intensely azure blue eyes Chris had ever seen in his life. It was as if Roy from FE6 had come to life in the real world.

But it was more than that. This redheaded teenager decked out in armor and Lycian nobleman garb was, in fact, Chris. The reality was so intense, Chris couldn't form words to describe his amazement. Roy's garb was a little dusty, his boots had dried mud on them, he had dirt under his fingernails, and his face looked a little dirty. It was as if Roy had magically been transported from the middle of a battle onto Chris. Every movement Chris made, Roy made in the mirror. Every facial expression Chris felt was portrayed by the redheaded youth.

Chris touched Roy's face... his own face. The face he felt was the face of Fire Emblem: The Sword of Seal's main character. Chris almost had to laugh. The way he existed now put every cosplayer in the entire history of dressing up as fictional characters to shame. Chris didn't just look like Roy, he didn't just sound like Roy or smell like Roy or feel like Roy; he WAS Roy (if Chris had known what Roy smelt, sounded, and felt like in the first place). Roy, son of Eliwood, Marquess of Pherae. Roy, the General of the Lycian Alliance who took on Bern, nabbed the Sword of Seals, and fought a demonic dragon... before becoming King of his homeland. For Chris, it was all just too unreal... and at the same time gazing into the azure eyes in the mirror, he knew, he was inside this body...

His train of thought was derailed however, when he heard the doorbell ring. Chris/Roy was shaken out of his thoughts and wondered who it could be... He realized he couldn't keep his transformation into a redheaded 15 year old general a secret from the world much longer no matter how hard he tried. He went to answer the door. He realized Roy was about his old height, maybe even a little taller. He wondered if fans would be disappointed that the "real" Roy wasn't as short as they all thought...

The person at the door was...
121.title: Roy

1212.content:
Chris opened the door and found Jane, his best friend practically since the two could walk, standing in the doorway. "Um, hello," she greeted politely, "I've never seen you before, I'm Jane. Is Chris home?"

"Jane," said Chris in Roy's voice, "you're not going to believe this, but... it's me, Chris!"

Jane looked shocked for a second. She then shook herself out of it and pushed her way past the redhead and into the house. "Uh, yeah. I don't know if that was meant to be a joke, but it wasn't funny in any case, dude. Who are you and where's Chris?"

"Jane, I'm serious," said Chris, "I'm not kidding at all. I was in my room just now before I blacked out and changed into this! Look at me, Jane, who do I look like?"

Jane looked Chris over. "A redheaded dude who's cosplaying something medieval," she replied immediately. She then realized something. "Wait a minute, you're dressed up as Roy from Fire Emblem 6! It's the most perfect cosplay I've ever seen."

"It's not a cosplay, Jane," said Chris, "I'm seriously inside the body of Roy. You've got to believe me."

"Okay then, pal, if you're Chris..." Jane pondered to herself something only the real Chris would know. She looked at her hand, on her finger was a cheap metal ring, a little girl's play accessory. "You recognize this ring?"

Chris looked at the ring, old, a little battered, but the memories surrounding it flooded back anyway, making him smile. "I gave you that ring when we both were 5 years old. You and me used to like playing the married game a lot," he chuckled at the memory, "we'd put rings on each other's fingers and pretend we were married. I told you one day to keep that ring even after the game was over... looks like you did... heh."

Jane looked into Roy's azure eyes and somehow found Chris looking through them. "Chris! It is you!" She gave him a hug before she blushed and backed away a little. "I'm sorry... I just... I'm so sorry, Chris."

"Don't be sorry, Jane, I think I needed that hug," admited Chris, making Jane blush more.

She cleared her throat. "So you just changed into Roy from FE6... by magic?" she asked.

"As far as I know, yes," replied Chris.

"Okay," said Jane, "something must've happened to make you turn into Roy..." Chris smiled slightly at Jane. She'd always been the smarter of the two, the rational, thinking one. "God you look just like him," she commented idly with a laugh, looking at him.

"I know," nodded Chris.

"Did anything out of the ordinary happen today before you transformed?" asked Jane.

"Well, not real- Wait!" Chris exclaimed. He only then felt and realized there was a metal necklace around his neck. He pulled it out from under his clothing and sure enough, there was the medallion. "I found this medallion on my way home from school... think it's got something to do with it?"

"Yes," said Jane, "I do. Given the fact that it's the only thing that you still have on you from before your transformation. I'll bet that's the guilty item. But... how to activate it."

"Well," said Chris, "just before I starting changing I was holding my FE6 cartridge. I was thinking about training up Roy and-"

"You were thinking about Roy," concluded Jane, "and had yourself in mind. I'll bet that's how it works."

"How can we be sure?" asked Chris.

"We're going to have to test it... on me," said Jane.

"What? No way! What if this is permanent?" asked Chris.

"I can think of far worse things to be stuck as, Chris. You may look quite a bit different, but at least you're still a teenaged guy and not a baby or an old man or someone of the opposite gender," pointed out Jane.

"Well, that's true," nodded Chris, "but I'm still not in my real body... if anybody's got to be permanently stuck in a different body, I'd like to keep it being me."

"That's very sweet of you, Chris," said Jane, "but we won't know if you can be changed back if we don't know how the thing works. Besides, if I have to be stuck as a character, it'd be the coolest to be stuck as a Fire Emblem character..."

Chris sighed. "Alright, I'll do it," he said. He looked at the medallion. "Any character in particular on your mind?"

"Just try not to make me a male character," she replied in jest.

"Oh, darn," joked Chris with a laugh. He started concentrating hard on Jane. He picked a Fire Emblem 6 character for her to transform into, which was...
1212.title: Jane meets Chris/Roy

1422.content:
Suddenly, Chris felt the medallion glow warm in his hand.

"Huh?" he said as he looked down at it. However, it soon vanished as quickly as it came. Chris had no idea what that was about. He decided to leave it be, as he placed the medallion on his dresser.

"Abby should be home by now. Guess I'll see what she is up to" Chris decided, leaving his bedroom. He walked downstairs, seeing Abby in the family room, beginning to watch some TV.

"Hey Abby, how are you?" Chris asked nicely. Abby turned to him and smiled. They always enjoyed a nice relationship, so they didn't fight alot.

"Hi Chris, I'm fine. You alright?" she asked.

"Pretty good" replied Chris.

"Good" said Abby. Then, she started going off again, talking about her day. "So today, I....."

She started but then suddenly stopped. Chris looked at her behaving strangely. She was trembling and it was hard for her to make words.

"Abby, are you ok?" asked Chris, putting a hand to her forehead. She didn't have a fever.

"W-What is going o-on? S-Something strange is h-happening..." stuttered Abby. She began to look worried. However, what happened right there would shock both of them.

Suddenly, Abby began growing right before his eyes. Chris was stunned at her sudden growth, as her little 8-year old body grew seemingly older. As it happened, you could see her growing into puberty, as her hips began to widen and little breasts grew on her chest. Both of them began to think that she was looking more like a young teenager now. However, that was only the beginning.

Abby's short blonde hair began to darken, becoming a deep brunette in the process. A couple of small accessories adorned her hair. Then, the more shocking changes came. Abby's pink shirt began fading to a yellow color, growing bigger on her. The hemline also began extending in the front, flowing down into her seat a bit. Some small degsigns finished off the garment, becoming a yellow chemise. Her light blue skirt also faded to the same yellow color, extending down to cover more of her longer legs. In addition, a small blue scarf wound its way around her neck.

Chris could see that this look was very familiar, but the last change sealed the deal. Abby's face began to contort and change, growing older like the rest of her and becoming a familiar sight as her eyes became a bright blue. Finally, a pair of wierd white sleeves grew on her arms, covering part of her hands.

Chris' eyes widened in realization at his sisters new look. She looked exactly like Mist now!
1422.title: Abby

14221.content:
After the incident passed, Abby was able to compose herself and look herself over. A look of horror soon adorned her face.

"W-What happened to me?! Why am I older?!" she almost yelled, noticing that her voice sounded different as well. She almost began to cry when Chris gently hugged her.

"Relax Abby. It'll be ok. We'll figure this out together" he said assuringly. That seemed to work as Abby calmed down enough to nod. At that, she tried to stand up, wobbling a bit as she wasn't used to being this tall.

"So what am I? How did this happen?" she kept asking. Chris didn't quite know how to respond, but he had to be honest about it.

"Well, you kind of look like Mist" he said, causing Abby to look at him.

"Mist? From that Fire Emblem game you have?" she asked.

"Yes. You look exactly like her" said Chris.

"But how did I change like this?" asked Abby. Chris thought for a moment. Then, he remembered the medallion. He was almost positive that it had something to do with this.

"I found something that looked like it was from the game. I'm not sure how but I think it changed you" said Chris. Abby could hardly believe that, but she knew Chris wouldn't lie about something like that.

Then, what happened?
14221.title: Reaction

choices: Go to the Fire Emblem world.
15331.content:
After trudging up the stairs, Chris took a right turn and went into his room, still wondering what the medallion was. Placing it on the bedside drawer, the teen then pulled out his Nintendo 3DS and booted up Fire Emblem: Awakening, having recently got it on the Eshop for a fairly cheap price.

Playing through the game, Chris thought about how he liked the characters and the relationships they had. One character in particular stuck in his mind: Lucina. He liked how badass she could be, as well as how cute she was without the mask.

"Lucina sure is cool... I wish I could meet her..." Little did he know, those words would soon seal his fate, because at that moment, the bronze medallion started to glow.

Eventually, the medallion glowed so bright, that Chris was forced to turn and look at it.

Suddenly, everything went black.
15331.title: Lucina

15333.content: Do you want either the first generation or the second generation?
15333.title: Parent or Child?

154.content:
Genealogy of the Holy War is split into two halves, and as such, follows two groups of heroes, the first being led by the Holy Knight Sigurd, and later, the rebellion led by his son, Seliph.

Which half will the character be from?
154.title: Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War

1542.content:
Alright, we shall use the 2nd generation lead by Seliph. Plenty of characters to pick there.

How about we start with the man himself. Seliph, son of Sigurd and Deirdre, and main lord of the story. Comes to wield the divine Tyrfing during his travels.

Next up is Julia. She possesses pure Naga blood, allowing her to use the divine dragon's power itself. She also has a troubled past, seeing her brother Julius become possessed by Loptous.
1542.title: Seliph's party.

15423.content:
Seliph has a few allies to help on his way.

The first is one of his guardians, Oifey. Oifey was the strategist for Sigurd's army, kept off the front lines until he had to take Seliph on the run. Learning to ride, use the sword and lance, and growing a badass mustache, he became Seliph's mentor and teacher of the sword-he has Baldur blood in him too.

Shaman was Seliph's other mentor and father figure. The future king of Issac, his aunt Ayra was fighting with Sigurd. He joined Oifey in taking care of Seliph (and his cousins, Ayra's twin son and daughter Ulster and Larcei, as well as Delmud, Lana, and Lester). He picked up the Balmung, one of the Holy Weapons, used by his ancestor Od.

Finally, Seliph has his cousin Leif, who has his own game to star in but is still fairly important. Leif is the son of Ethelyn, Sigurd's sister, and Sigurd's bro-in-law Quan, who was set to inherit the kingdom of Leonster... until their rival, the king of Thracia, Travant murdered his parents in the desert of Yied via flying wyvern attack. Leif's older sister Altena is kidnapped and raised by Travant, while he is raised by Finn, Quan's subordinate, a long with Nanna, the daughter of Lachesis, an ally of Sigurd.
15423.title: More Choices

choices: Mystery of the Emblem (Original & DS Remake)
155.content: What about one of the other two Super Famicom games?
155.title: More Choices

1551.content: Is this the original Super Famicom version of the game, or is this its DS remake, "New Mystery of the Emblem ~Heroes of Light and Shadow~"?
1551.title: Which Version?

15511.content: Is this Book 1 or Book 2?
15511.title: Which Book?

choices: Leif, the exiled son of Quan and Ethlyn, with no Major Holy blood to his name.
Nanna, Leif's girlfriend and supporter, and the cousin of the Black Knight Ares.
Finn, a knight of Quan's who defends Leif with his life, wielding a Brave Lance.
1552.content:
Ah, Thracia 776, the interquel of Genealogy of the Holy War, focusing on Seliph's cousin Leif, who fights a desperate battle against the kingdom of Thracia, as shown by the game's crushingly hard difficulty.

Now then, what important character will someone become?
1552.title: Thracia 776

1553.content: What about Fire Emblem Gaiden or Fire Emblem Fates?
1553.title: More choices

15531.content:
Alright, so it's coming from Gaiden, or, slightly more specifically, it's remake, Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia.

There are two 'routes', one focusing on male protagonist Alm, the other focusing on female protagonist Celica.

Which character are we grabbing from what route?
15531.title: Fire Emblem Gaiden

15532.content: Is this Hoshido, Nohr, or the Third Route?
15532.title: Which Path?

1553211.content:
Alright, we can divide most of the cast of Hoshido into four categories, which will cover all of them:

1. The royals (Corrin, Azura, Ryoma, Hinoka, Takumi, and Sakura)

2. The retainers (Kaze and Silas, Saizo and Kagero, Setsuna and Azama, Oboro and Hinata, and Subaki and Hana)

3. Hangers-on (Kaden, Hayato, Rinkah, Orochi, etc.)

4. The children characters (Shiro, Kiragi, Kana, etc.)
1553211.title: Hoshido

15532111.content:
Welp, royals it is then.

Corrin and Azura are essentially the main characters of the story, so first page goes to them. Both have peculiar powers compared to the rest. They interest you?
15532111.title: Royals.

155321113.content:
Alright, then, we have the rest of the Hoshido royal family:

Firstly, we have the eldest prince Ryoma. He is a samurai with honor and pride, who uses the divine katana Raijinto, which is enchanted with electricity.

Secondly, we have the elder sister Hinoka. She rides a pegasus, and is a fiery-tempered tomboy who wants to keep her siblings safe. She is very good with a lance.

Thirdly, we have younger brother Takumi. He is an archer, and he has something of an inferiority complex, wanting to prove himself. He uses the Fuujin Yumi, a divine bow that can control wind.

Finally, we have the youngest sister, Sakura. She is a priestess, who uses a staff to heal and support. She is shy and timid, but she wants to be stronger.
155321113.title: More Choices

1553211134.content: Okay, so who becomes her then?
1553211134.title: Sakura

1553212.content:
Alright, we can divide most of the cast of Nohr into four categories, which will cover all of them:

1. The royals (Corrin, Azura, Xander, Camilla, Leo and Elise)

2. The retainers (Kaze and Silas, Laslow and Peri, Selena and Beruka, Odin and Niles, and Effie and Arthur)

3. Hangers-on (Keaton, Nyx, Charlotte, Benny, etc.)

4. The children characters (Siegbert, Forrest, Kana, etc.)
1553212.title: Nohr

15533.content:
What if it's an item from the mobile spin off Heroes?

Or the Dynasty Warriors spin off, FE Warriors.

Or the collectable card game Cipher?
15533.title: More choices

155331.content: Okay, so to start, which land should we go with.
155331.title: Heroes.

choices: Alfonse, Prince of Askr, and the only guy who can Triple Brazen.
Sharena, Princess of Askr, who nulls buffs and Triple Bonds.
Anna, the Commander, who really just... teleports with Noatun.
1553311.content: Who is our transformation going to be?
1553311.title: Askr

choices: Veronica, princess, possesed by dark blood, uses dark magic. Or maybe it's Brave
Bruno/Zacharias, a hunky prince who worked with Askr at one point. Those abs tho
1553312.content: We... kind of only have two characters from Embla.
1553312.title: Embla

15533121.content:
Alright, Veronica it is.

Let's clarify one point though. Two Veronica's exist in the game. One being the princess that's focused on in the main story, and her "brave" version that comes from another world and seems to be friendlier.

So, which shall it be?
15533121.title: Veronica, princess, possesed by dark blood, use...

choices: And, here, a Loki option because we don't know what side she's on.
1553313.title: More Choices

15533131.content:
On that note, we have a few characters.

To start, there's 2 of the Nifl royals. We first have Fjorm, the 2nd Princess of Nifl who wields the spear Leiptr.

Another is her older sister Gunnthra, who is the eldest Princess and has a powerful connection with dreams.
15533131.title: Nifl

155331313.content:
We have the other two Nifl royal siblings.

We have the only son of the family, Hrid, who wields the sword Gjoll and rises a horse. He's older than Fjorm but younger than Gunnthra.

Finally, there's the youngest sibling, Ylgr, who uses the dagger Sylgr.
155331313.title: More Choices

15533132.content:
Alright, so from Muspell, how about we start with the two siblings.

We have Laevatein, a young girl and 2nd Princess who wields a sword bearing her name. She thinks of them as one in the same.

Next is Laegjarn, eldest Princess of Muspell who wields a sword atop a wyvern. Lacks the pure strength of her sister, but fights honorably.
15533132.title: Muspell

155331323.content:
Aside from Laeg and Laev, there are two other major characters from Muspell.

The first is their dad, Surtr, a emperor of fire who is off his rocker and wants to see the world burn. His wife, and his daughter's mother, is never mentioned, and he wields a powerful axe known as Sinmara, which damages anyone close to him with a burst of flame (I think).

The other important character is the third Muspell general, and the sibling's co worker Helbindi. Helbindi is a hard-working if... handsomeness challenged man who wants to provide for his family, especially his sister Menja. His axe, Byleistr, boosts his and adjacent ally stats every even turn.
155331323.title: More Choices

155334.content: What if it's the latest, upcoming Fire Emblem game, Three Houses?
155334.title: Other.

choices: Unaffiliated (Byleth, Jeralt, Rhea, those who slither, Cyril, Shamir, etc.)
1553341.content: Alright, which House's character should we select from?
1553341.title: Three Houses!

choices: The other Blue Lions (Dedue, Ashe, Mercedes and Annette).
15533413.content:
There are 8 Blue Lions, so we'll start with the childhood friend quartet:

-Dimitri is the young prince of the northern kingdom of Faerghus. He is adept with swords and lances, has good leadership skills, and can grow into being adept with horses. He is a kind and chivalrous person... at first. But after the time skip, his anger and vengeance bubble up as he wields his family's lance, Areadbhar with monstrous strength. Bears the Crest of Blaiddyd.

-Felix's family, the house of Fraldarius, is closely associated with Dimitri's-his father was friends with Dimitri's and he's been seeing the prince on and off since childhood. But Felix is a cold and sarcastic individual as a result of his older brother Glenn dying in the Tragedy of Duscur. After seeing... something of Dimitri, he refers to him as the "Boar Prince". Skilled with the sword, bow, and physical brawling, and having a hidden aptitude for Reason magic of the lightning variety, Felix eventually gets his hands on his family's relics, the Sword of Moralta and the Aegis Shield. Bears the Crest of Fraldarius.

-Ingrid's family of the Galateas is an offshoot of the Daphnel family of the Alliance, but she grew up with and calls Faerghus her home. Her family is noble but poor, and so she was offered as an arranged marriage to Glenn, Felix's older brother. The pairing did like each other-but when Glenn died at the Tragedy of Duscur, she decided to become a knight to bring honor to her family (despite her father wanting her to marry rich). She is skilled with the sword and lance, and is adept with animals, whether horses, pegasi, or wyverns. She bears the Crest of Daphnel, which lets her wield the family's lance, Luin.

-Sylvain had a rough time growing up. The younger son who bore his Crest, that of the Gautier family, his older brother Miklan was disowned and attempted to kill him several times growing up. Being seen as useful only for his Crest, he developed a womanizing outer shell to hide his inner sadness and frustration at the Crest system. He is a childhood friend of Dimitri, Felix and Ingrid-much to their consternation with his flirting. He is skilled with lances and axes, is good with horses, and has a hidden aptitude for Reason magic-learning fire magic as well as Saggitae. His Crest of Gautier lets him use his family's Lance of Ruin.
15533413.title: Blue Lions

1553342.content: What about Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE?
1553342.title: Other option...

info.brief_description: Chris Skyler's life is changed when he finds an item from his favorite game series.
info.description:
Hello everyone! This is a redone version of my other story, Fire Emblem Morph Story. I figured this would be the best way to start things over and make things easier to write. I hope that others can come and enjoy this as much as I do.

Storyline is the same as before. The character finds an artifact resembling the Fire Emblem that transforms him and can allow him to change others and go into the games' themselves.

Simply put, the medallion found can change the user into a new character. It can also be used by the user to change someone else as well as go into the game world of that respective character. It's also possible for the user to go into the game unchanged. There can be multiple changes at the same time.

Out of the characters used for transformation, there may be some male characters. However, the majority of options will be for female characters.

Also, the story will start off a little slow because it'll be determining the first transformation and who ends up transforming. From that point on, things will develop quicker.

Here are the rules as usual:

1. Keep it PG-13!
2. You can have sex, but not descriptive and try not to have too much.
3. Keep language PG-13 and also keep it tame (like not cursing every sentence)
4. Keep the story going and no killing the characters.
5. Try to make it a good length if possible.


Character List:

1. Chris Skyler: 16 years old, short dirty blonde hair, blue eyes. High School sophmore. Loves to read and play video games. A little shy but very friendly.

2. Jane Cross: 16 year old girl. Long brown hair with green eyes. Childhood friend of Chris who she has a crush on. Shares his love of video games, especially fantasy RPG's. She often beats him in certain games like that.

3. Ben Skyler: 10 years old. Dirty blonde hair and blue eyes. Chris' younger brother. A typical younger brother who also has his interests in video games.

4. Abby Skyler: 8 years old. Chris' little sister. Not much interest in games, more into the typical girly stuff. Shoulder-length blonde hair with blue eyes. Doesn't hate games or anything, but just not really into them.

5. Anthony Hartford: 16 years old. Tall with dark brown hair and same color eyes. A lone wolf type of guy but a very good friend of Chris. Shares love of games as well.

6. Judith Hartford: 9 years old. Anthony's younger sister.

As another note, all pictures used belong to their respective owners. Just as a disclaimer.
